00002 /*   9.0  Status
00003 
00004 These values are updated by the algorithm and written to the status file
00005 (along with the information provided by house.getFrameInfo).
00006 */
00007 // 2004-09-16 rcarson fixed position of an error message

00026 void Status::init(Params &params, int &argc, char**& argv)
00027 {
00028   struct utsname mpihost; //current node information
00029   proc = MPI::COMM_WORLD.Get_rank();
00030   numProcs = MPI::COMM_WORLD.Get_size();
00031   Log * log = Log::getLog();
00032   if(uname(&mpihost)<0){
00033     string msg="Error in uname";
00034     log->outputMessage(msg,FRAME, 0);
00035     MPI::COMM_WORLD.Abort(-1);
00036   }
00037   stringstream ss;
00038   ss<<"Task "<<argv[0]<<" beginning from processor "<<proc<<" : "
00039     <<"node "<<mpihost.nodename<<" , process ID "<<getpid(); //KW
00040   log->outputMessage(ss.str(),FRAME,0);
00041   statusCode =RUNNING;
00042   iter=subset=0;  
00043   time_t mytime;
00044   time(&mytime);
00045   int myseed = -mytime;
00046   seed = myseed;
00047   if(params.frame.verbosity>=5)
00048     cout<<" Seed is "<<seed<<" mytime is "<<mytime<<endl;
00049 
00050   fileName = params.frame.frameDirectory+"/"+
00051     params.frame.outputFileNameBase+"."+
00052     params.extensions.status;
00053   jobStartTime = setReconTime();
00054   determineEventLoad();  // Put together the eventLoad array (uses MPI).
00055 
00056   barrierTimes.init(this->numProcs, params.algorithm.numIterations);
00057   barrierTimes = 0;
00058 }
00059 
00060 /*****************************************************
00061  * read
00062  * Reads the status file.  Runs on all processors.
00063  * The status file may contain any number of comment lines that begin
00064  * with '#'.   These lines are skipped over by this function.
00065 
00066 *********************/
00067 void Status::read()
00068 {
00069   ifstream fStatus(fileName.c_str());
00070   if(!fStatus) {
00071       cout<<"Erroring open status file "<<fileName<<endl;
00072       MPI::COMM_WORLD.Abort(-1);
00073   }
00074   int code;
00075   //const int bufferSize = 50;
00076   char buffer[256];
00077   char ch;
00078   string bufstring;
00079 
00080   // First read in the status code
00081   do{getline(fStatus,bufstring);}while(bufstring[0]=='#');
00082   { // block to contain iss
00083     istringstream iss(bufstring,istringstream::in);
00084     iss>>code;
00085   }
00086   // Next read iteration and subset
00087   //skip all comment lines, i.e., those starting with '#'
00088   do{getline(fStatus,bufstring);}while(bufstring[0]=='#');
00089   { // block to cntain iss
00090     istringstream iss(bufstring,istringstream::in);
00091     iss>>iter>>subset;
00092   }
00093   // Next read jobstarttime and currenttime
00094   //skip all comment lines, i.e., those starting with '#'
00095   do{getline(fStatus,bufstring);}while(bufstring[0]=='#');
00096   { // block to contain iss
00097     istringstream iss(bufstring,istringstream::in);
00098     iss>>jobStartTime>>currentTime;
00099   }
00100   // Finally read in the generic comment
00101   //skip all comment lines, i.e., those starting with '#'
00102   do{getline(fStatus,bufstring);}while(bufstring[0]=='#');
00103   { // block to contain iss
00104     istringstream iss(bufstring,istringstream::in);
00105     iss >> comment;
00106   }
00107 
00108   //statusCode =StatusCode(code) ;
00109   Params *params= Params::getInstance();
00110   if(params->frame.verbosity==Constant::TESTSTATUSREAD){
00111     cout<<"Iteration and subset number "<<endl;
00112     cout<<iter<<" "<<subset<<endl;
00113     cout<<"Job starting time and current time "<<endl;
00114     cout<<jobStartTime<<" "<<currentTime<<endl;
00115     cout<<"Comment "<<endl;
00116     cout<<comment<<endl;
00117     cout.flush();
00118     MPI::COMM_WORLD.Abort(-1);
00119   }
00120     
00121 }

00124 //write to status file
00125 void Status::write()
00126 {
00127   ofstream fStatus(fileName.c_str());
00128   if(!fStatus) {
00129       cout<<"Erroring open status file "<<fileName<<endl;
00130       MPI::COMM_WORLD.Abort(-1);
00131   }
00132   fStatus<<"# Status code"<<endl;
00133   fStatus<<statusCode<<endl;
00134   fStatus<<"# Iteration and subset number"<<endl;
00135   fStatus<<iter<<" "<<subset<<endl;
00136   fStatus<<"# Job starting time and current time"<<endl;
00137   fStatus<<jobStartTime<<" "<<currentTime<<endl;
00138   Params *params= Params::getInstance();
00139   int numIter = (this->iter >= params->algorithm.numIterations)?
00140                      params->algorithm.numIterations:this->iter-1;
00141   for(int i=0 ; i < numIter; i++) {
00142      fStatus<< "# Barrier Times in seconds for procs (0 - "<<this->numProcs-1<<")@ iteration: "<<(i+1)
00143               << endl;
00144      for(int j=0 ; j < this->numProcs ; j++) {
00145         fStatus << barrierTimes(j,i)<<" ";      
00146      }
00147      fStatus << endl;
00148   }
00149  
00150   fStatus<<"# Comment by recon engine"<<endl;
00151   fStatus<<comment<<endl;
00152   fStatus.flush();
00153   fStatus.close();
00154 }

00159   comment = comm;

00162 //set status code
00163 void Status::setStatusCode(StatusCode code)
00164 {
00165   if(code<SUBMITTED || SWAPPING<code)
00166     {
00167       cout<<"Erroring setting status code: out of range"<<endl;
00168       return;
00169     }
00170   statusCode = StatusCode(code);
00171 }

00175 //set reconTime as current clock time
00176 string Status::setReconTime()
00177 {
00178   struct tm *tmPtr;
00179   time_t theTime;
00180     
00181   (void) time(&theTime);
00182   tmPtr = localtime(&theTime);
00183   stringstream ss;
00184   ss<<setfill('0')<<setw(2)<<tmPtr->tm_hour<<":"
00185     <<setfill('0')<<setw(2)<<tmPtr->tm_min<<":"
00186     <<setfill('0')<<setw(2)<<tmPtr->tm_sec;
00187   return  ss.str();
00188 
00189 }

00192 //update status file without frameInfo
00193 void Status::update(string comm, StatusCode code)
00194 {
00195         
00196   currentTime = setReconTime();
00197   setComment(comm);
00198   setStatusCode(code);
00199   write();
00200 }

00203 /*********************************************************************
00204  * getEventLoad
00205  * This function returns the rescaled proportional event load for the
00206  * specified processor.  This number should be based on the clock
00207  * speed of the processor as specified in the /proc/cpuinfo file.  In
00208  * the event that not all processors were able to read in their clock
00209  * speeds, then the value returned bere will always be 1*rescale.
00210  * @param procnum - The processor rank in question, for which the
00211  * proportional load is being queried.
00212  * @rescale - A floating point value that should represent the maximum
00213  * proportion.
00214  * @return - The rescaled proportional event load of the specified
00215  * processor.
00216  **********/
00217 
00218 float Status::getEventLoad(int procnum, float rescale)
00219 {
00220   // Note that eventLoad is private.
00221   float retval = eventLoad[procnum]*rescale;
00222   return retval;
00223 }
00224 
00225 
00226 
00227 /**********************************************************************
00228  * determineEventLoad
00229  * This function puts together the private instance array eventLoad.
00230  * The array is allocated with numProcs elements.  This function is
00231  * called from init().  It uses an MPI global collect operation to put
00232  * together the array. The array is then scaled according to its
00233  * maximum so that valid values have a range from zero to one.  If
00234  * there are any negative values in the array, then all elements in
00235  * the array are set to 1.
00236  *******************************************/
00237 
00238 void Status::determineEventLoad()
00239 {
00240   Params &params = *Params::getInstance();
00241   eventLoad = (float *)calloc(numProcs,sizeof(float));
00242   float *helper;
00243   helper = (float *)calloc(numProcs,sizeof(float));
00244   helper[proc]=determineCPUspeed();
00245   MPI::COMM_WORLD.Allreduce(helper,eventLoad,numProcs,MPI::FLOAT,MPI::SUM);
00246 
00247   if((proc==0)&&(params.frame.verbosity >=3)){
00248     cout<<"Processor "<<proc<<" has a clock speed of "<<eventLoad[proc]
00249         <<" MHz." << endl;
00250   }
00251   if((proc==0)&&(params.frame.verbosity >=2)){
00252    cout<<"Processor speeds (MHz):";
00253    for(int i=0; i<numProcs; i++) 
00254        cout<<eventLoad[i]<<" ";
00255    cout<<endl;
00256   }
00257 
00258   // first determine if any of the nodes report zero or negative values
00259   bool hasNonPositive=false;
00260   for(int i=0;i<numProcs;i++){
00261     if(eventLoad[i] <=0){
00262       hasNonPositive=true;
00263     }
00264   }
00265 
00266   // If there are any zeroes or negatives, set all load values to 1
00267   if(hasNonPositive){
00268    // Report flat CPU lgorithm  in the log
00269    if((params.frame.verbosity >=1)&&(proc==0)){
00270      cout << "WARNING: A nonpositive CPU speed has been reported."  << endl
00271           << "Smart event distribution is being disabled."<<endl;
00272    }
00273     for(int i=0;i<numProcs;i++){
00274       eventLoad[i]=1.0;
00275     }
00276   }
00277   else{  // Scale load values to the maximum in the array, so that all
00278          // values are less than or equal to 1.
00279     float maxLoad = -9.9e30;
00280     for(int i=0;i<numProcs;i++){
00281       if(eventLoad[i]>maxLoad) maxLoad=eventLoad[i];
00282     }
00283     for(int i=0;i<numProcs;i++){
00284       eventLoad[i] /= maxLoad;
00285     }
00286   }
00287   if((proc==0)&&(params.frame.verbosity >=2)){
00288    cout<<"Processor event loads:";
00289    for(int i=0; i<numProcs; i++)
00290        cout<<eventLoad[i]<<" ";
00291    cout<<endl;
00292   }
00293 
00294 }
00295 /***************************************************************
00296  * determineCPUspeed
00297  * This is a private function , called from within determineEventLoad,
00298  * that reads the /proc/cpuinfo file to determine the clock speed of
00299  * the processor, in MHz.  NOTE that this is a Linux-only feature.
00300  * Should the computer not have such a file as /proc/cpuinfo, the
00301  * return value will be negative, which indicates that active load
00302  * balancing should not be attempted.
00303  *@return The clock speed in MHz.
00304  ******************************/
00305 
00306 float Status::determineCPUspeed()
00307 {
00308   const string filename = "/proc/cpuinfo";
00309   string cpuline;
00310   char buff[256];
00311   ifstream cpufile(filename.c_str());
00312   
00313   if(!cpufile){
00314     cout << "Warning: In Status::getCPUspeed(), Processor "<<proc
00315          <<" failed to open file "<<filename<<" ."<<endl
00316          <<"The smart event distribution will be disabled."<<endl;
00317     return(-1.0);
00318   }
00319   do{
00320     if(cpufile.eof() || cpufile.fail()){
00321       cout<<"Warning: In Status::getCPUspeed(), Processor "<<proc
00322           <<" failed to find the line identifying clock speed in "
00323           << filename << "." << endl
00324           <<" The smart event distribution will be disabled."<<endl;
00325       cpufile.close();
00326       return(-1.0);
00327     }
00328     cpufile.getline(buff,256);
00329     cpuline = buff;
00330   }while(cpuline.find("MHz")==string::npos);
00331   
00332   size_t index = cpuline.find_last_of(":");
00333   if(index==string::npos){
00334     cout<<"Warning: In Status::getCPUspeed(), Processor " << proc
00335         << " failed to find the colon delimiter in the line identifying"
00336         << " clock speed in "<<filename <<endl
00337         << "The smart event distribution will be disabled."<<endl;
00338     cpufile.close();
00339     return(-1.0);
00340   }
00341   string substring = cpuline.substr(index+1);
00342   float retval = (float)atof(substring.c_str());
00343   cpufile.close();
00344   Params &params = *Params::getInstance();
00345   if(params.frame.verbosity >=3){
00346     cout << "In Status::determineCPUSpeed(), processor "<<proc
00347          << " is reporting a clock speed of "<<retval<<" MHz."<<endl;
00348   }
00349   return(retval);
00350 }

00352 string logFile = "";
00353 void Status::printMemInfo() {
00354 
00355   pid_t pid = getpid();
00356   char strPid[50];
00357   sprintf(strPid,"%d",pid);
00358   if(logFile == "")  {
00359         Params &params = *Params::getInstance();
00360         stringstream file;
00361         file<< params.frame.frameDirectory<<"/"<<
00362          "proc-"<<proc<<"-memUsagelog";
00363         logFile = file.str();
00364         system(string("touch "+logFile).c_str());
00365   }
00366   string cmdStr = "ps -o etime,size,rss "+string(strPid)+" | tail -1  >>"+logFile;
00367   system(cmdStr.c_str());
00368 }
